elements.title: tree of life (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Charles Darwin used a tree of life model (sketch pictured) to conceptualise his theory of evolution?

elements.title: Esther Shephard (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that American folklorist Esther Shephard collected tall tales from logging camps in the state of Washington to complete her 1924 book about Paul Bunyan?

elements.title: Battle of Puketutu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Māori believed that the failure of the rockets launched at a pā (fort) during the Battle of Puketutu was due to rites and rituals performed during its construction?

elements.title: a 1975 kidnapping (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a lawyer got his client acquitted of a 1975 kidnapping by accusing the victim of masterminding his own abduction—but in 2020 admitted that he had known it was a lie?

elements.title: Habib Noh (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a teenager planned to blow up the tomb of Islamic saint Habib Noh because he believed that it was un-Islamic?

elements.title: was badly mauled by two chimpanzees (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that former NASCAR driver St. James Davis was badly mauled by two chimpanzees while visiting one who was the best man at his wedding?

elements.title: City & Guilds Computer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the City and Guilds of London Institute developed the City & Guilds Computer virtual machine as part of their 1960s teaching materials?

elements.title: Mimi Kilgore (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Mimi Kilgore gifted Willem de Kooning a frog that had been run over by a car?
